meanings.definition: The quality or state of being dull, heavy, or uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The stodginess of the lecture made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: Her writing lacked excitement due to the stodginess of her style.
meanings.sent3: The stodginess of the party made everyone yawn.
meanings.sent4: The stodginess of the old library was like a heavy blanket weighing down on visitors.
meanings.sent5: The stodginess of the museum exhibit made it forgettable and unappealing.

meanings.definition: A tendency to be overly formal or conservative in behavior or thinking.
meanings.sent1: His stodginess in following rules made him seem inflexible.
meanings.sent2: The company's stodginess prevented them from adapting to new trends.
meanings.sent3: The stodginess of the professor's outfit was comical in a modern setting.
meanings.sent4: Her stodginess in sticking to tradition was like being stuck in the past.
meanings.sent5: The stodginess of the committee stifled any creative ideas from emerging.
